{{Infobox sports league | title = North West Junior Hockey League (NWJHL) | current_season = | logo = NWJHL Alberta Logo.jpg | pixels = 180px | caption = The NWJHL Logo | sport = [[Ice Hockey]] | founded = {{Start date|1994}}â95 | inaugural = | ceo = Allan Spence | headquarters = | teams = [[#List of teams|8]] | country = {{Flag|Canada}} (8 teams) | continent = [[North America]] | champion = [[Whitecourt Wolverines]] (3rd title) | most_champs = [[Fort St. John Huskies]] (5) | TV = | website = [http://www.nwjhl.com/ www.nwjhl.com/] | Formerly = }} The '''North West Junior Hockey League''' is a [[Junior ice hockey|Junior "B"]] [[Ice Hockey]] league operating in the [[Peace River Country|Peace River region]] of [[Alberta]] and [[British Columbia]], [[Canada]], sanctioned by [[Hockey Canada]]. The winner of Northwest "B" playoffs earns the chance to compete for the Western Canadian Junior "B" Crown, the [[Keystone Cup]]. To earn the right to compete, they must face off against the winners of the other Alberta "B" leagues in the [[Russ Barnes Trophy]]. ==Teams== ===List of teams=== {| class="navbox wikitable" style="width:100%; text-align:left" ! style="background:#3756A8; width:17%" | Team ! style="background:#3756A8; width:15%" | City ! style="background:#3756A8; width:23%" | Arena ! style="background:#3756A8; width:5%" | Founded ! style="background:#3756A8; width:5%" | Joined !
